Tasks.Task Description: Continuously monitor the health and performance of the AKS cluster using Azure Monitor and Kubernetes-native tools. Identify and resolve any anomalies or issues.
Ensure the AKS cluster is configured for autoscaling to handle workload changes. Regularly review and adjust node pool scaling settings as needed.
Apply security patches to the AKS cluster nodes and ensure the Kubernetes version is up-to-date. Review and implement security updates promptly.
Implement and test backup solutions for AKS workloads and configurations. Ensure disaster recovery plans are in place and tested regularly.
Plan and execute upgrades for the AKS cluster to newer Kubernetes versions. Ensure minimal disruption during the upgrade process.
Review and update network policies to ensure secure communication between pods and services within the AKS cluster.
Analyze resource utilization within the AKS cluster to identify inefficiencies and optimize workloads.
Develop and execute incident response plans for AKS cluster issues. Use Kubernetes logs and Azure diagnostics to troubleshoot and resolve problems.
Review and update RBAC settings to ensure proper access control for AKS resources. Audit permissions regularly.
Scan container images for vulnerabilities before deploying them to the AKS cluster. Use Azure Security Center or third-party tools for scanning.
Regularly review audit logs for the AKS cluster to detect unauthorized access or suspicious activities.
Perform regular health checks on pods and services running in the AKS cluster. Ensure workloads are functioning as expected.
Keep AKS cluster documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, configurations, and troubleshooting guides.
Perform regular compliance checks to ensure the AKS cluster adheres to relevant regulations and industry standards.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding AKS performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
